title: Honoring Harold Taylor upon the occasion of his designation as recipient of the 2011 J. Walter Juckett Award
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring Harold Taylor upon the occasion of his
designation as recipient of the 2011 J.  Walter  Juckett  Award  by  the
Adirondack Regional Chamber of Commerce

WHEREAS,  Individuals  who give of their time and energies and serve the
best interests of their communities are an asset beyond remuneration and
cannot be sufficiently extolled; and
  WHEREAS, Harold Taylor has given not only of his time and energies but
also of his competence, intelligence and leadership and consequently has
been designated for special honor; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is justly proud to honor Harold  Taylor
upon the occasion of his designation as recipient of the J. Walter Juck-
ett  Award  by the Adirondack Regional Chamber of Commerce at its annual
dinner celebration to be held at Heritage Hall in the Glens Falls  Civic
Center on Saturday, January 29, 2011; and
  WHEREAS,  This  prestigious award, specially designed and commissioned
through the Sandy Hill Foundation, is named after  the  late  J.  Walter
Juckett who served as chairman of the former Sandy Hill Corporation; and
  WHEREAS,  Harold  Taylor,  affectionately  known as Bud, was chosen to
receive this honor for taking a leadership role in many community initi-
atives and non-profit organizations, as well as demonstrating his  lead-
ership  skills  by example as a hands-on contributor to numerous associ-
ations; and
  WHEREAS, Harold Taylor has been called upon to contribute his time and
talents to countless civic and charitable endeavors and has always given
of himself unstintingly; and
  WHEREAS, A retired insurance agency owner, Harold Taylor has long been
involved in both government and community organizations;  he  has  ambi-
tiously  spearheaded  efforts  to  build a concert shell and a new field
house in Crandall Park, and was also instrumental in the  relocation  of
the Open Door Mission; and
  WHEREAS,  Representing  the  3rd  Ward on the City Common Council from
1998-2005, Harold  Taylor  also  served  on  the  City  Planning  Board;
currently,  he  is in his second term representing Glens Falls' 3rd Ward
on the Warren County Board of Supervisors; and
  WHEREAS, Harold Taylor is Founder and President of the  Crandall  Park
Beautification  Committee,  a  private  organization that has undertaken
park improvement projects, such as the concert shell and the  new  field
house;  furthermore,  he  is  President  of  the  Board of the Open Door
Mission; and
  WHEREAS, Harold Taylor serves proudly on the boards of the Glens Falls
Civic Center Foundation, Warren-Hamilton Community Action Agency, Warren
County Local Development Corporation and the Warren-Washington  Counties
Industrial Development Agency; and
  WHEREAS, A loyal member of the Glens Falls Kiwanis Club and congregant
of  Saint  Mary's  Roman  Catholic Church, Harold Taylor has also been a
Little League baseball coach; and
  WHEREAS, Throughout the entire period  of  his  community  service,  a
period  of constructive involvement, Harold Taylor has stood constant in
dignity, good grace and humor; and
  WHEREAS, Known for being a modest and generous man, Harold  Taylor  is
extremely  worthy  of this esteemed community service award, often going
above and beyond without recognition for the benefit of those who reside
within the Adirondack region; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  that  those  who
enhance  the  wellbeing and vitality of their community and have shown a
long and sustained commitment to excellence certainly  have  earned  the

recognition and applause of all the citizens of this great Empire State;
now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Harold Taylor upon the occasion of his designation as recipient of
the J. Walter Juckett  Award  by  the  Adirondack  Regional  Chamber  of
Commerce; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Harold Taylor.
